meanings.definition: (adjective) In a slanting or oblique direction.
meanings.sent1: The *italic* letters on the sign were slanted to the right.
meanings.sent2: She wrote her name in *italic* letters on the card.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked in an *italic* path, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The tree cast an *italic* shadow on the ground as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The car skidded to a stop in an *italic* manner, narrowly avoiding a collision.

meanings.definition: (noun) A style of typeface with letters that slant to the right.
meanings.sent1: The book title was written in *italic* to make it stand out.
meanings.sent2: The article was printed in *italic* for emphasis.
meanings.sent3: The *italic* font made the words look fancy and elegant.
meanings.sent4: The *italic* style added a touch of sophistication to the document.
meanings.sent5: The logo was designed with an *italic* typeface to give it a modern look.

meanings.definition: (verb) To emphasize or highlight something by using italic type.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to *italic* the important points in her presentation.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to *italic* the key phrases in the text.
meanings.sent3: He would always *italic* the titles of his favorite books.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to *italic* the answers for clarity.
meanings.sent5: The editor suggested to *italic* the headings for better readability.
